thm:description.p: This property specifies transition duration time
This property specifies interval beetween transitions
This property specifies event, which toggles state of the element
This property specifies the display mode for the Deck widget

thm:integerType.thm:description: The table will display specified number of rows pere page.

thm:description.p: This property specifies pagination for table widget

thm:property.thm:name: mcs-cancelable

thm:keyword.thm:name: always
thm:keyword.thm:description: Wizard step is cancelable.

thm:keyword.thm:name: never
thm:keyword.thm:description: Wizard step is not cancelable.

thm:property.thm:description: This property controls whether wizard step is cancelable.

thm:description.p: This property specifies initial state of a widget e.g. folding-item
This property specifies time delay

thm:keyword.thm:name: none
thm:keyword.thm:description: Slideshow will not start automaticly

thm:description.p: Specified the time, after which the slideshow will be automatically launched. If not present, the slideshow will not be automatically launched.

thm:keyword.thm:name: yes
thm:keyword.thm:description: An object will automatically start playing

thm:keyword.thm:name: no
thm:keyword.thm:description: An object will not start playing automatically

thm:description.p: Specifies, whether object should automatically start playing, or not.

thm:keyword.thm:name: normal
thm:keyword.thm:description: The order will not be changed

thm:keyword.thm:name: reverse
thm:keyword.thm:description: The order will be reversed

thm:keyword.thm:name: random
thm:keyword.thm:description: Items will appear in random order

thm:description.p: Specifies the order of the items.

thm:keyword.thm:name: infinite
thm:keyword.thm:description: The slideshow will repeat infinitely

thm:integerType.thm:description: The slideshow will repeat specified number of times.

thm:description.p: Specified the order of the items in the slideshow. The values have the following meaning:

thm:keyword.thm:name: split
thm:keyword.thm:description: Split times will be taken

thm:keyword.thm:name: lap
thm:keyword.thm:description: Lap times will be taken

thm:description.p: Spacifies the count mode used in widget:stopwatch

thm:keyword.thm:name: photo
thm:keyword.thm:description: Map will be displayed in satelitte mode

thm:keyword.thm:name: map
thm:keyword.thm:description: Map will be displayed in satelitte mode

thm:keyword.thm:name: hybrid
thm:keyword.thm:description: Map will be displayed in hybrid mode

thm:description.p: Spacifies the map-style used in widget:map

thm:keyword.thm:name: normal
thm:keyword.thm:description: A standard time, depending on context

thm:description.p: e.g in Slideshow widget the time of display of a single item.

thm:keyword.thm:name: infinite
thm:keyword.thm:description: The number items is not limited.

thm:description.p: This property specifies number item to display

thm:keyword.thm:name: automatic
thm:keyword.thm:description: The accesskey values will be automatically assigned to the <menuitem> elements. If the <menuitem> specified an accesskey this will be overridden by the automatic generation.

thm:keyword.thm:name: manual
thm:keyword.thm:description: No generation of accesskey will occur an all accesskey attributes specified on the <menuitem> elements will be honored.

thm:description.p: This property specifies how dtmf keys are assigned to child <menuitem> elements, this can either be automatic or manual. The values of this property have the following meanings:

thm:keyword.thm:name: dialog
thm:keyword.thm:description: The grammer of this menu is only active for the duration of this menu.

thm:keyword.thm:name: document
thm:keyword.thm:description: The grammer of this menu is active during processing of the whole page. If this is the root page then the grammer is active through out the whole session.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the scope of the menu, either dialog or document. It may only be applied to <menu> elements. The values of this property have the following meanings:
This property specifies a dynamic visual to use as the background.

thm:property.thm:name: mcs-break-after

thm:keyword.thm:name: always
thm:keyword.thm:description: For each item in the group the form fragment and another will be started.

thm:keyword.thm:name: never
thm:keyword.thm:description: The group does not end a form fragment

thm:property.thm:description: This property controls whether and where form fragmentation occurs.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the color of the caret displayed in a text input field..
This property specifies what level of adornment the chart has. The value 'none' means that the chart has no adornments and 'all' means that it has all the adornments.
This property specifies the different colors of the chart's components. The position of the color in the list determines which chart component is affected.
This property affects the color of the chart's grid.
This property specifies the height of the chart as a percentage of the height of the display device in pixels.
In future we will probably support being able to specify the height of the chart as a length.
This property affects whether the chart values are labelled.
This property specifies the width of the chart as a percentage of the width of the display device in pixels.
In future we will probably support being able to specify the width of the chart as a length.
This property specifies the angle through which the x axis of the chart should be rotated.
This property specifies the angle through which the y axis of the chart should be rotated.

thm:keyword.thm:name: current
thm:keyword.thm:description: The element will use the current container.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the container within the current layout within which the element and its contents will be written.
This property specifies the radius of the corners of the rounded rectangle which is drawn around the specified element.

thm:keyword.thm:name: accept
thm:keyword.thm:description: The element accepts the focus.

thm:keyword.thm:name: ignore
thm:keyword.thm:description: The element ignores the focus.

thm:description.p: This property specifies whether the element should accept the focus or ignore it.

thm:keyword.thm:name: none
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that an image should not be used for the form action.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the image to use when a form action is rendered as an image. See the mcs-form-action-style property.
This can take either a Mariner image component name, or a URI.

thm:keyword.thm:name: default
thm:keyword.thm:description: The action is displayed in the default way for the device, this may be either as a button, or as a item in a menu.

thm:keyword.thm:name: image
thm:keyword.thm:description: The action is displayed as an image which is specified in the mcs-form-action-image property. If the target device does not support images in form actions, or an associated image could not be found then this will be treated as default.

thm:keyword.thm:name: link
thm:keyword.thm:description: The action is displayed as a link. If the target device does not support a form being submitted by a link then this will be treated as default.

thm:description.p: This property specifies how a form action should be displayed.

note.p: Customers must not rely on a target device's lack of support for a style in order to achiieve their desired look. This is because we are constantly improving the quality of our device support which could mean that we start supporting one or more of them on a device which did not previously support it. This would have the effect of changing the pages rendered for that device.

thm:keyword.thm:name: horizontal
thm:keyword.thm:description: The list is to be generated horizontally with a single space separating each link.

thm:keyword.thm:name: vertical
thm:keyword.thm:description: The list is to be generated vertically with one link per line.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the orientation of the list of links to fragments generated within the root fragment of a canvas.

thm:keyword.thm:name: top
thm:keyword.thm:description: The list is to be generated at the top of the canvas.

thm:keyword.thm:name: bottom
thm:keyword.thm:description: The list is to be generated at the bottom of the canvas.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the position of the list of links to fragments generated within the root fragment of a canvas.
This property specifies an image to associate with an element.
This property specifies the time between each frame within an animated image..
This property specifies the index of the initial frame of an animated image to display.

thm:keyword.thm:name: indefinite
thm:keyword.thm:description: The image will not stop looping as long as it is displayed.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the number of times that an animated image should repeat.

thm:keyword.thm:name: default
thm:keyword.thm:description: The device specific default.

thm:keyword.thm:name: disallow
thm:keyword.thm:description: Tries to prevent the image from being saved by the client.

thm:description.p: This property controls whether an image is allowed to be saved by the target device or not.
This property defines the action applied on validation failure.
This property defines the format (validation) applied to a text input field.

thm:keyword.thm:name: current
thm:keyword.thm:description: The element will use the current layout.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the layout to be associated with the element.
This property specifies the gap between lines in pixels.

thm:keyword.thm:name: normal
thm:keyword.thm:description: The same as the current page.

thm:keyword.thm:name: tv
thm:keyword.thm:description: A TV page.

thm:keyword.thm:name: web
thm:keyword.thm:description: A Web page.

thm:description.p: This property specifies what media the target of the link is intended for.

thm:keyword.thm:name: default
thm:keyword.thm:description: The default style used by the target device for links.

thm:keyword.thm:name: button
thm:keyword.thm:description: The link is rendered as a button inline in the page. If the target device does not support a link being rendered as a button then this will be treated as link.

thm:keyword.thm:name: numeric-shortcut
thm:keyword.thm:description: The menu will be rendered with numeric identifiers for each menu item. These identifiers provide a shorcut key for that menu item.If the device does not support shortcuts then the link will be rendered using the link

thm:description.p: This property specifies how a link (anchor) will be represented to the user.

thm:keyword.thm:name: integral
thm:keyword.thm:description: The media is an integral part of the page and should be automatically retrieved and rendered by the browser.

thm:keyword.thm:name: external
thm:keyword.thm:description: The media is external to the page and requires the user to perform an explicit action in order to render the media.

thm:description.p: Specifies the style of the media. It is a list of two possible values in order of preference.

thm:keyword.thm:name: none
thm:keyword.thm:description: Causes no separator character to be inserted between items.

thm:keyword.thm:name: space
thm:keyword.thm:description: Causes a normal space character to be inserted between items.

thm:keyword.thm:name: non-breaking-space
thm:keyword.thm:description: Causes a non breaking space (Unicode 160) to be inserted between items.

thm:description.p: This property specifies how to separate menu items in menus that are oriented horizontally.

thm:keyword.thm:name: none
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that the image information in each menuitem is to be ignored

thm:keyword.thm:name: plain
thm:keyword.thm:description: IIndicates that the static image information in each menuitem is to be used in creating the menu

thm:keyword.thm:name: rollover
thm:keyword.thm:description: IIndicates that the rollover image information in each menuitem is to be used in creating the menu

thm:description.p: This property specifies how image information is to be used in creating the menuitems for this menu.

thm:keyword.thm:name: text-only
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that when both image and text information is being used in each menuitem, only the text should be active.

thm:keyword.thm:name: image-only
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that when both image and text information is being used in each menuitem, only the image should be active.

thm:keyword.thm:name: both
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that when both image and text information is being used in each menuitem, they should both be active.

thm:description.p: This property specifies which of the menuitem parts (image and text) is active when more than one part is present.

thm:keyword.thm:name: automatic
thm:keyword.thm:description: Each menuitem that will be output to the pane referenced by the menu will be written to a separate instance of that pane within the spatial iterator.

thm:keyword.thm:name: none
thm:keyword.thm:description: Every menuitem that will be output to the pane referenced by the menu will be written to the first instance of the pane within the spatial iterator.

thm:description.p: This property specifies how menuitems will be allocated when the menu references the stem name of a pane that is within a spatial iterator.

thm:keyword.thm:name: image-first
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that when both image and text information is being used in each menuitem, the image information should appear before the text information.

thm:keyword.thm:name: text-first
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that when both image and text information is being used in each menuitem, the text information should appear before the image information.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the order in which the menuitem parts (image and text) are to be used in constructing the menu when more than one part is present. Only one kind of image and one kind of text can be shown in a single menuitem. The types of image and text are controlled by the mcs-menu-image-style and mcs-menu-text-style style properties respectively.

thm:keyword.thm:name: horizontal
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that when both image and text information is being used in each menuitem, they should be oriented horizontally.

thm:keyword.thm:name: vertical
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that when both image and text information is being used in each menuitem, they should be oriented vertically.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the orientation of the contents of a menuitem when more than one item is present.

note.p: There are no guarantees that every combination of mcs-menu-orientation and this property are supported on each protocol.

thm:keyword.thm:name: active
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that the shortcut (and associated separator) will be active, i.e. it will be inside the link.

thm:keyword.thm:name: inactive
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that the shortcut (and associated separator) will be inactive, i.e. it will be outside the link.

thm:description.p: This property specifies whether the shortcut is an active part of the menu items belonging to the subject menu.

thm:keyword.thm:name: default
thm:keyword.thm:description: The menu will be shown in the default style for the device. The menu items will be rendered according to the menu item specific properties.

thm:keyword.thm:name: numeric-shortcut
thm:keyword.thm:description: The menu will be rendered with numeric identifiers for each menu item. These identifiers provide a shorcut key for that menu item.If the device does not support shortcuts then the link will be rendered using the default

thm:description.p: Specifies the style of menu to use. This could be a traditional style menu or an enhanced "OpenWave" style menu.

thm:keyword.thm:name: horizontal
thm:keyword.thm:description: The menu is to be generated horizontally with an optional separator between each item.

thm:keyword.thm:name: vertical
thm:keyword.thm:description: The menu is to be generated vertically with one item per line.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the orientation of menu items within a menu.

This property specifies one or more characters to be used as the separator between groups of menu items. For example, the single character - might be used. Alternatively the group *----* could be chosen.

The separator is created by repeating the characters specified in this property the appropriate number of times. Where the separator characters property contains multiple characters and an integer number of repetitions would create a separator longer than that required (see below) the extra characters are simply truncated.
The number of characters in the separator is defined by the related property mcs-menu-separator-repeat.

thm:keyword.thm:name: none
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that an image should not be used for the menu separator.

thm:description.p: This property specifies an image to be used as the separator between groups of menu items.

thm:keyword.thm:name: after
thm:keyword.thm:description: The separator appears after the group of menu items.

thm:keyword.thm:name: before
thm:keyword.thm:description: The separator appears before the group of menu items.

thm:keyword.thm:name: both
thm:keyword.thm:description: The separator appears both before and after the group of menu items.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the location of a separator used to delimit a group of items within a menu.
This property specifies the number of times to repeat the separator characters to create the separator.
Where the value of this property is 0, the separator must contain the same number of characters as the longest item in the menu to which the menuitemgroup belongs.

Note: Where proportionally spaced fonts are in use, the actual length of the separator may be different from the length of the items in the menu item group. There is no requirement to attempt to match the physical length of the separator to that of the items themselves.

thm:keyword.thm:name: none
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that no separator is required.

thm:keyword.thm:name: image
thm:keyword.thm:description: The separator is the image and specified by the associated mcs-menu-separator-image property.

thm:keyword.thm:name: characters
thm:keyword.thm:description: The separator is a set of characters defined by the mcs-menu-separator-characters and mcs-menu-separator-repeat properties.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the type of separator used to delimit a group of items within a menu.

thm:keyword.thm:name: static
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that the menu is static

thm:keyword.thm:name: dynamic
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that the menu is dynamic

thm:description.p: This property specifies whether the menu is to be static or dynamic.

thm:keyword.thm:name: none
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that the text information in each menuitem is to be ignored

thm:keyword.thm:name: plain
thm:keyword.thm:description: Indicates that the text information in each menuitem is to be used in creating the menu

thm:description.p: This property specifies how text information is to be used in creating the menuitems for this menu. Note that rollover text menus are created as a combination of plain text menus and the hover pseudo class

thm:keyword.thm:name: center
thm:keyword.thm:description: Center the movie in the browser window and crop the edges if the browser window is smaller than the movie.

thm:description.p: This property specifies how the Flash movie window is positioned within the browser window.

thm:keyword.thm:name: high
thm:keyword.thm:description: favors appearance over playback speed and always applies anti-aliasing. If the movie does not contain animation, bitmaps are smoothed; if the movie has animation, bitmaps are not smoothed.

thm:keyword.thm:name: medium
thm:keyword.thm:description: applies some anti-aliasing and does not smooth bitmaps. It produces a better quality than the Low setting, but lower quality than the High setting.

thm:keyword.thm:name: low
thm:keyword.thm:description: favors playback speed over appearance and never uses anti-aliasing.

thm:keyword.thm:name: auto-high
thm:keyword.thm:description: emphasizes playback speed and appearance equally at first but sacrifices appearance for playback speed if necessary. Playback begins with anti-aliasing turned on. If the actual frame rate drops below the specified frame rate, anti-aliasing is turned off to improve playback speed. Use this setting to emulate the View > Antialias setting in Flash.

thm:keyword.thm:name: auto-low
thm:keyword.thm:description: emphasizes speed at first but improves appearance whenever possible. Playback begins with anti-aliasing turned off. If the Flash Player detects that the processor can handle it, anti-aliasing is turned on.

thm:keyword.thm:name: best
thm:keyword.thm:description: provides the best display quality and does not consider playback speed. All output is anti-aliased and all bitmaps are smoothed.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the level of anti-aliasing to be used during playback of a movie. Because anti-aliasing requires a faster processor to smooth each frame of the movie before it is rendered on the viewer's screen, choose a value based on whether speed or appearance is your top priority:

thm:keyword.thm:name: show-all
thm:keyword.thm:description: This makes the entire movie visible in the specified area without distortion, while maintaining the original aspect ratio of the movie. Borders may appear on two sides of the movie.

thm:keyword.thm:name: no-border
thm:keyword.thm:description: scales the movie to fill the specified area, without distortion but possibly with some cropping, while maintaining the original aspect ratio of the movie.

thm:keyword.thm:name: exact-fit
thm:keyword.thm:description: makes the entire movie visible in the specified area without trying to preserve the original aspect ratio. Distortion may occur.

thm:description.p: This property specifies how the movie is placed within the browser window when WIDTH and HEIGHT values are percentages.
The default value is showall if this attribute is omitted (and width and height values are percentages).

thm:keyword.thm:name: center
thm:keyword.thm:description: The movie is centred in the browser window. Cropping may occur or borders may appear on any side, as needed.

thm:keyword.thm:name: center
thm:keyword.thm:description: The movie is centred in the browser window. Cropping may occur or borders may appear on any side, as needed.

thm:description.p: This property specifies where a scaled Flash movie is positioned within the area defined by the width and height settings. See mariner-mmflash-scale for more information about these conditions.

thm:keyword.thm:name: window
thm:keyword.thm:description: plays the movie in its own rectangular window on a Web page.

thm:keyword.thm:name: opaque
thm:keyword.thm:description: makes the movie hide everything behind it on the page.

thm:keyword.thm:name: transparent
thm:keyword.thm:description: makes the background of the HTML page show through all the transparent portions of the movie, and may slow animation performance.

thm:description.p: This property takes advantage of the transparent movie, absolute positioning, and layering capabilities available in Internet Explorer 4.0. It works only in Windows with the Flash ActiveX control and the <OBJECT> tag.
This property specifies the gap between paragraphs in pixels. It is a global setting which affects the whole page.

thm:keyword.thm:name: caption-first
thm:keyword.thm:description: The caption is rendered before the control where before is defined in terms of the reading order.

thm:keyword.thm:name: control-first
thm:keyword.thm:description: The control is rendered before the caption where before is defined in terms of the reading order.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the layout of each individual option within a selection list which is being rendered using the controls style. See the mariner-selection-list-style property.

thm:keyword.thm:name: controls
thm:keyword.thm:description: The selection list is displayed as separate captions and controls. The controls will behave either like radio buttons, or checkboxes depending on whether the selection list allows only a single value, or multiple values to be selected at once.

thm:keyword.thm:name: default
thm:keyword.thm:description: The selection list is displayed the default way for the device.

thm:keyword.thm:name: circular-list
thm:keyword.thm:description: If this selection list is an xfsiselect is displayed as a spin control on browsers that support this type of control. If the device does not support the use of spin controls or this selection list is an xfmuselect then the selection list is displayed in the default way for the device as if "default" had been used.

thm:keyword.thm:name: menu
thm:keyword.thm:description: If the selection list is displayed as a popup menu on browsers that support this type of control. If the device does not support the use of popup menu's or this selection list is an xfmuselect then the selection list is displayed in the default way for the device as if "default" had been used.

thm:description.p: This property controls how selection list input controls are displayed.

thm:keyword.thm:name: normal
thm:keyword.thm:description: The normal device specific behaviour is used.

thm:keyword.thm:name: focus
thm:keyword.thm:description: The selection list will display when the field has the focus.

thm:keyword.thm:name: select
thm:keyword.thm:description: The selection list will display when the field is selected.

thm:description.p: This property controls what will trigger a selection list to be displayed.
This property specifies how many characters wide a text input control should be.
This property specifies how many characters high a text input control should be.
This property specifies a system font.
This property specifies the size of rounded corner.
This property specifies the size of rounded corner.
This property specifies the size of rounded corner.
This property specifies the size of rounded corner.

thm:keyword.thm:name: none
thm:keyword.thm:description: Produces no blinking.

thm:keyword.thm:name: blink
thm:keyword.thm:description: Blinks.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the line style for line-through text decoration.
This property specifies the line color for line-through text decoration.

thm:keyword.thm:name: none
thm:keyword.thm:description: Produces no line.

thm:keyword.thm:name: solid
thm:keyword.thm:description: Produces a solid line.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the line style for line-through text decoration.
This property specifies the line color for overline text decoration.

thm:keyword.thm:name: none
thm:keyword.thm:description: Produces no line.

thm:keyword.thm:name: solid
thm:keyword.thm:description: Produces a solid line.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the line style for overline text decoration.
This property specifies the line color for underline text decoration.

thm:keyword.thm:name: none
thm:keyword.thm:description: Produces no line.

thm:keyword.thm:name: solid
thm:keyword.thm:description: Produces a solid line.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the line style for underline text decoration.

thm:keyword.thm:name: none
thm:keyword.thm:description: The content does not move at all.

thm:keyword.thm:name: alternate
thm:keyword.thm:description: Content alternates from one side of the screen to the other.

thm:keyword.thm:name: scroll
thm:keyword.thm:description: Content will move onto and then off the screen.

thm:keyword.thm:name: slide
thm:keyword.thm:description: Content will move onto the screen.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the marquee effect that will be used if the contents of the element require scrolling.

thm:keyword.thm:name: left
thm:keyword.thm:description: The content moves from right to left.

thm:keyword.thm:name: right
thm:keyword.thm:description: The content moves from left to right.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the initial direction in which marquee content will move.

thm:keyword.thm:name: infinite
thm:keyword.thm:description: The content never stops moving.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the number of times that marquee content will move across the screen before it stops.

thm:keyword.thm:name: normal
thm:keyword.thm:description: The content moves at the normal velocity which is 6 characters per second, e.g. 6em/1s.

thm:description.p: This property specifies the velocity at which the marquee content will move across the screen.
This property specifies the velocity at which the marquee content will move across the screen.
